citeinfo.origin: GIS Implementation Team, Washington State Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: Counties of Washington State

descript.abstract: The counties of Washington state are depicted as polygons.
descript.purpose: This data set is intended for use as a reference map layer for GIS applications.

cntperp.cntorg: Geographic Services, Washington State Department of Transportation

browse.browsed: The graphic represents the data as projected on the Washington State Plane Coordinate System, South Zone.

idinfo.native: Arc/Info coverage, version 7.1.2 for NT 4.0, and ESRI shape file

citeinfo.origin: GIS Implementation Team, Washington State Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: Washington State County Series, County Boundaries

attracc.attraccr: County names are complete and spelled correctly.

dataqual.complete: The data represent every county in the State of Washington.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy has not been determined.

citeinfo.origin: Cartography Section, Washington State Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: state.dgn, 1994

srcinfo.srccontr: The graphics depicting the counties and the names of the counties.

procstep.procdesc: The Microstation DGN file was converted to an Arc/Info coverage with the Arc command "IGDSARC" and transformed to geographic coordinates with Arc commands "PROJECTDEFINE" and "PROJECT."

enttyp.enttypd: Areas of Washington state defined as counties by the Constitution of Washington State.
enttyp.enttypds: Data Resource Management, Washington State Department of Transportation

attr.attrdef: Type of boundary line for cartographic presentation
attr.attrdefs: GIS Support Team, Washington State Department of Transportation

edom.edomvd: international--the boundary divides a Washington State county from British Columbia.
state--the boundary divides a Washington State county from Oregon or Idaho.
county--the boundary divides two Washington State counties.
offshore--the line falls over a major body of water.

attr.attrdef: A number assigned to each county based on its alphabetical listing order.
Federal Information Processing Standard code number
attr.attrdefs: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attrdomv.udom: Adams, Asotin, Benton, Chelan, Clallam, Clark, Columbia, Cowlitz, Douglas, Ferry, Franklin, Garfield, Grant, Grays Harbor, Island, Jefferson, King, Kitsap, Kittitas, Klickitat, Lewis, Lincoln, Mason, Okanogan, Pacific, Pend Oreille, Pierce, San Juan, Skagit, Skamania, Snohomish, Spokane, Stevens, Thurston, Wahkiakum, Walla Walla, Whatcom, Whitman, Yakima

overview.eaover: Counties are depicted as polygons with county name as an attribute. County boundary lines are assigned attributes signifying whether or not the line is over a major body of water, between counties, states, or international.

cntinfo.cntinst: Call, email or write with requests for geo-spatial data sets.

distinfo.distliab: The Washington State Department of Transportation shall not be liable for any activity involving these data with regard to lost profits or savings or any other consequential damages; or the fitness for use of the data for a particular purpose; or the installation of the data, its use, or the results obtained.

digtinfo.formspec: Various formats are used: ESRI coverages and shapefiles, and data tables for placement as ArcView "events."
digtinfo.formcont: The standard distribution compact disc contains all geospatial data sets created by the Washington State Dept. of Transportation. Refer to the included Geodata.txt text file for a brief description of the directory structure. Data formats vary--most data are stored as ESRI shape files, but some data models require coverages. There are also dbf-format tables of data located by geographic coordinates or State Route Accumulated Route Mileage.

stdorder.ordering: Call, email or write the Distributor with requests for geo-spatial data sets.
stdorder.turnarnd: Generally, the standard compact disc containing all distributed data can be sent within one week of receiving a data request.

digtinfo.formcont: Depends on the data set. Arc/Info coverage or shape file; metadata report in html and text files; and, in some cases, a data dictionary text file. Some data sets in the standard distribution are tabular data for placement as ArcView "events."
digtinfo.filedec: Run the "exe" file under Windows NT.

onlinopt.accinstr: Use anonymous FTP login or web browser download on the URL specified under Network Address.

stdorder.nondig: The Cartography/GIS Section can plot maps of most geospatial data sets.
stdorder.ordering: Contact the Point of Contact listed under the Identification Section to determine the availability of this data set in a non-digital representation.

cntinfo.cntinst: Call, email or write with requests for geo-spatial data sets.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
